e4: Transitioning to the new policy enhances ethical standards by ensuring transparent and accurate earnings reporting. This fosters trust with investors, aligns with regulatory expectations, and minimizes potential legal issues. While there may be short-term market misinterpretations, clarifying the change through proactive investor communication can mitigate potential negative impacts.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure transparency, accuracy, and honesty, providing stakeholders with a true representation of the company's financial health. It should comply with legal and regulatory standards, avoiding manipulative practices that mislead investors. Ethical policies should also consider the potential impact on all investors, including retail, to maintain trust and fairness.
e6: I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in policy to avoid misunderstanding amongst investors, what educational efforts will be undertaken to mitigate retail investor disadvantage, and how they anticipate and plan to address any initial negative market reactions.
